availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin F. Springfield (Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Person County, North Carolina, native. Son of George Springfield and Rebecca Springfield. Married to Martha A. Townsend Springfield in Hopkins County, Kentucky, on October 1, 1859. Married to Henrietta Springfield. Father of Florence M. Springfield. Resident of Hopkins County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 125A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 721.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 656.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 212A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Precinct 4, p. 85A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Marriages, p. 145-46.
"Benjamin Franklin Springfield (1838-1900)," Find A Grave, Memorial #98246933, accessed December 15, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98246933.
